Replies.Reply: Distant STARS, with vast tracts of darkness stretching between them. Move in on OUR SUN, dwarfed in the immense cosmic ocean.
You ever feel small?
How do you stand out from the crowd?
With them it was love at first song.
First rule of survival: get yourself laid before winter.
Apparently I only just made it.
Afterwards Mum went off to the sea to keep warm. Dad stayed home like dad's do, incubating.
Caruso's the leader because he's so incredibly old. Some say more than 40, but you know how penguins exaggerate.
My dad was never that devout. Often his mind was on other stuff.
I guess he was wrong about a lot of things.
Ow! Freezy, Fuh-Fuh-Freeezy! All Freezy!
Replies.Didascalie: (hopping from one foot to the other)

Replies.Reply: So What happens now, Dad?
Is she coming soon?
Sorry. When I get happy my feet get happy too.
But Why Dad?
What's fish look like.
Did she get one. Did she bring one back.
Can I see it?
I got one! I got a mum everyone. I got a MUM!!
After that, with food being so scarce everyone was busy busy busy. Mom and dad were working so hard I didn't see much of them. Besides I had school to go to.
Swimming? Catching Food?
That doesn't make any sense.
You like it?
It's not?
Oh, La la la la la  A croaky monotone.   The class LAUGHS OPENLY.
La la la la la la la la!!
But that's what I'm doing,  The class fall about in HYSTERICS.
I'm thinking.
What?
I'm being spontanuous.
Oh yes.
I couldn't face the class in this mood So I just kept going.
Looking for what? I don't know? A different type of penguin?
And that's exactly what I found.
Not the nicest place in the world but at least you could do what you liked here.
Me? Oh, nothing. What are you doing?
Leg or wing?
Wait! WAIT!
Every seen anything like this?
Hey! What's that on your leg?
Unbelievable.
At least those aliens didn't eat you.
So - You think I could appeal to your better nature?
Caruso. He couldn't help himself.
Dad, Ma, can I go with the others  NORMA J. puts a protective flipper around her son.
Dad? I'll learn to sing later. I'll find my voice out there. In the deep. Truly.
Dad. Pul-eeeze.
Yeooow!!
Thanks Pop. See ya Ma.
Outta my way flipperbirds! Coming through!!
I had an instinct I'd be good at this.
Ella?
I've got you! No I don't.
Yes I do.
The only bad thing about being with Ella.
Ella? You get one?
Here, have it.
I want you to have it.
Take it. Really. Its for you  ELLA leans forward, takes the fish, and daintily gulps it down.
You're welcome.
OK! I'll quit. OK!
Woah. Whose there.
OK. I'm awake now. You got me  He looks around - an unfamiliar landscape of ice - then over the side, seeing nothing but slowly spreading ripples.
The murderous creature comes at him, jaws open, baring rows of sharp TEETH and MUMBLE swims for his life.
HEEEELP!!
Do what?
I didn't do anything.
Wow, there are so many of you!
The shortage has affected you too?!
You really think so?
So for a while I forgot about finding a song altogether.
Oh! There you are  Terrified the Adelies scatter and shoot to the surface like missiles.
Guys!    I want to speak to you.
But that's what we have to find out.
The who?
Why stones? Wait for me  LOVEDAY'S MOUND  MUMBLE and the ADELIE AMIGOS are bunched together, near the head of a LONG QUEUE of Adelies each with a stone or in their beak.
I was wondering. Have You ever been abducted by Aliens?
Looks like they bestowed it very tight.
So these Mystic Beings, did you see them?
Did they have frontways eyes? No feathers? Fat flabby faces? Did they probe you and stick a pointy thing into you?
But I haven't had any answers yet!
La la la la la la la laaaaaaaaaaaaa!!
See. That's how I ended up with you guys.
You can?!
Ella turns to see: a PENGUIN backlit by the sun, standing HEROICALLY on a little rise, just as WISHFUL did.
Oh, and I want her so badly How can I tell her I love her?
Hi Ella, what do you think?
Ella. Wait!
I'm sorry.
Don't care? I never stopped thinking about you.
I can't sing.
But I'll show you something better  He TAPS an up-tempo, syncopated rhythm on the ice.
Sing something to this!
Just try it. This once.
Okay, that'll work. Just keep it going.
This is it Ella! This is the song inside me!
Wait. Wait. You think it's my fault that there are no fish?!! Doing Happy Feet can't cause a food shortage.
BACK OFF, YA SCREWY-ASS FLIPPERBIRD!
You too pa?!
No. Dad. No. What have they done to you.
No. You're nuts. All of you. I'm outa here.
Its no use Ella. I can't live with that.
Now go back. I love you. Go.
To find the mystic beings.
We'll ask Loveday. He's been there.
Just one question! And I want a straight answer! Where do I find the Mystic Beings?
No. He's choking! The Talisman's gotten way too tight.
Stop. You're hurting him.
LOVEDAY, where did you get it?
They didn't bestow it on you?
If it wasn't bestowed, what happened?
Loveday, did you ever meet a Mystic Being? Really?
But this thing was made by someone. And if we find them, they could take it off.
So where do we Go, Loveday  Loveday Then he makes a strange "Oi, Oi, Oi" sound.
Hear that?!
We're looking for the Mystic Beings  ELEPHANT SEAL 2 Mystic Who?
Aliens, the ones who made this.
Could they be taking our fish?
But If your grandpappys saw them and they survived, maybe they're not so fierce.
We need to huddle!
Form a moving circle! Share the cold, share the warmth!
I said a circle!
Just keep moving! Toboggan, if you have to!!
You think this is it? The Forbidden Shore?
Hello?! Is there anyone out there?
Hello!!
What is it?
They must be here somewhere.
A whale?
The ones with teeth!!
LOVEDAY! LOVEDAY!!
Aliens?!
They've stopped!
Excelsi yah!!!
HEY! YOU CAN'T DO THAT!
HEY YOU THINK YOU'RE GONNA GET AWAY WITH THIS?!! NOT IF I CAN HELP IT YOU SHIT-
Too loud.
Too loud!
The Convergence?
I'm trying to talk to the Aliens!
On the black iceberg. The ones taking all the fish!
Where's that. Do you think the Whale would take me there?
When I finally saw one, the Alien was even more hideous than I'd imagined  A very pretty FEMALE SCIENTIST is smiling down at him.
The - fish - are - ours. Understand?
We can't live without them!
Speak Adelie? Skua-talk?
Oh no! Not the pointy thing!
Excuse me, where are we.
Where?
Every day after that, it rained fish in the afternoon.
Fish on land and fish underwater.
Sometime you got a live one but there was nowhere really to chase it  He swims SLAP BANG into a sheet of thick glass. ALIEN FACES are pressed against it. Mumble yells and shoots to the surface.

Aliens everywhere, watching you eat, watching you sleep  Mumble backs away and knocks into the PAINTED HORIZON. He puts out a wing to steady himself and notices a metal tag on it. This place is beginning to upset him.
What have you done to my wing! This is not my home! I want to get out of here!
After a while, you learn to stop fighting it. Stop protesting, take the knocks.
Another day and another. Night follows day follows night.
Sometimes I thought about dad and mum.
What? What did I do?
You like that? Well how about this.
Hi, where is everybody!?
I used to live here. When's the Great Gathering?
This is all that's left?
Ella! Is it you. You haven't changed a bit.
Are these all yours?
But that's fantastic. I've got so much to tell you - to tell everyone.
I found out who's been causing the Scarcity!
I know who's been taking our fish!
No, honestly Aliens will be here soon!
But its true!!
It's so they can find me.
That's them now. Listen.
You said they didn't exist.
No. Do this. Do Happy feet.
Come on, everyone! Happy Feet! It's our only chance!
FEET!!
FEET! FEET!! HAPPY FEET!!
penguinos!
From that day on, No one quite knows how it happened, but the black icebergs began to disappear and the fish became abundant once more.
Ella's gave up teaching to look after our chick. We take turns looking after her and going to get the fish.
I worry about her, sure. Theres so much big stuff out there it can be kind of frightening.
The spinning blue marble.
Vast, pristine, stupendous. Washed with dawn light. A few small BLACK-SUITED FIGURES are moving towards us.
With infinite care, THE EGG is passed from Norma J's feet onto WISHFUL's.
Follow Mumble as he wanders alone, back towards his class.
EMPEROR PENGUINS all over the place, Its chaos - Grand central station - with everyone SINGING to each other.
"Love me tender love me true, all my dreams fulfil.
I'll miss you.
Oh no! I dropped it! Where's my egg!
S'okay. S'okay. No harm done.
But I did learnt this from him:    the power of positive thinking  We are moving in again, towards the huddle, the voices of the Great Male Gathering begin to cut through the wind blasts.
Whoa li'l buddy, slow down!
What? Come on. He'll grow out of it.
Come here, li'l Mumble. Let's get you warm and toasty.
Any day now.
Well tell em don't.
Everyone's hungry son. The mommas are bringing fish soon.
NORMA J.?!
Since my baby left me. I found a new place to dwell.
O Honey. O Baby. You made it!
You hurt?
I called him Mumble.
Is there really nothing we can do?
Just do it. Pray to the Forefathers for forgiveness.
Just do what the kid says.
You know who that is? That's my boy!
Wind comes shreiking across the ice shelf to where THOUSANDS OF MALES are huddled, ice crusting on their feathers.
We Remain.
We Remain.
Deny the pangs of hunger.
Brothers, BROTHERS! The Devotions!
Graduates, today you leave the safety of our community for the first time, forsaking the trusted solid ice for the terrible magic of the deep.
Excelsi-yah! Yah yah yah!
Happy WHAT?! This is an OUTRAGE!
"Together we stand"
Louder. More fervent bretheren.
You led them here. Are you crazy!!
They'll slaughter us. Head for the sea!
Recite the wisdoms!
CHANT!!
CARUSO.
The tiny penguin soaring off the top of the ICEBERG.
Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa, pal!
Fish time. Fish time!
Who wants to know?
We turn the world once more.
We bring back the sun.
The ICE itself is moaning and groaning, like a living thing.
An EGG cracks open, then another, then all in a rush, like POPCORN.
Late opener, huh? You thinks its alive?
Well, how about that?
It's our Heartsong, Miss.
Mumble?
Go Mumble!
Mumble?
Woah!
Not this time.
Thank you Mumble, but it's yours.
Hey! That's a felony! Mumble, let go!
Mumble!
Thank you.
Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir?
Mumble?
Mumble, that's just cheap  She turns and heads off. The Adelie starts after her.
When you left without saying goodbye I thought something had happened, then I thought he just doesn't care.
I know. I know. Its impossible.
Wait! Mumble!
Can you live without it?
I believe in you, Mumble. But without the huddle we can't make an egg. Without the egg, what are we here for?
Mumble?! Its Mumble!!
They're my singing students.
Of course not. I was waiting for you.
Huh?
So who fixed him up with this.
A LONG LINE of male penguins, thousands of them, all with their chicks, stand staring expectantly across the ice shelf.
But who's this.
Aw. But isn't he just a darling?
a seal!
The ICE-SHELF is as busy as a freeway at peak hour with males and females are hurrying BACK AND FORTH from the sea.
An efficient, caring TEACHER is giving a lesson to a class of about thirty young chicks grouped in front of her.
MUMBLE stands some distance back from where the other young penguins are taking school lessons.
Settle class. Settle. We will begin with the most important lesson you will ever learn. Now does anyone know what that is?
Michael?
True but, that's not it. Mumble?
Anyone else?
Your Heartsong. Yes. The melody you hear inside, the thing that makes you different from every other penguin. So.
Well Michael, if you think that's really you. What have you got for us, Ella?
You heard that in there?
Dear, that's not even a tune.
La la la la la la la la.
Listen carefully, Mumble. La la la la la la la la!!
La La La La La La La La!
Of course there is. Thats why we have Mrs Astrakhan.
Don't eat yellow snow?
Me! Me! I've got one!
CAN'T SINK? Rubbeesh. Every little pengvin has a sonk. Vhen I have feenished, your singink vill be givink everyone the goosepeempel.
Don't think EET!! Feel eet!
Vhat? Vhat is this?
The feet. The jiggy-jog. Don't do eet. Do not move muscle.
And be spontanuous.
No! Stop! No jiggy-jog!
Not with the feet, with the sonk!
Hokay. Enough. Stop. Hokay! Ve go back to the top. Forget the body, look inside the soul. No notes, no sonk, only feelink.
Yes, yes, lift up the head! That's it!
Disaster! Catastroff! I never fail!
More feelink. BE SPONTANUOUS!!
Know him? He ees my star pupol!
Before him, a wasteland of discoloured ice covered with broken eggs and bits of feather. There are very few penguins here and the ones he can see are all, frankly, weird.
Hey, whacha doin' dere flipperbird?
So fly flipperbird. Fly.
And dis time I'm getting the juicy bits.
Nope.
Interesting you should ask?
Shaddap! The flipperbird aksed me a question.
I got two words for ya: "Alien Abduction".
Replies.Didascalie: (fixing Mumble with a crazy bloodshot eye.)

Replies.Reply: Quiet ya ignorant morons!
Aks me how I know.
Whaddayamean unbelievable?! It's true!
Gets worse! I woke up and there's dis thing on me!
True. I guess my cries for mercy appealed to their better nature.
Hey! Whatcha think ya doin' down dere flipperbird? Get back up here dis minute!
No! No! Don't startim on that!
As night slowly pales to a misty dawn and Mumbles lonely floe drifts off, turning slowly in the current  Music Over: "The tracks of my tears"
Excelsi-yah ! Yah yah yah!

Follow Mumble as he returns to his parents. In his adult plumage he's distinguishable by a small birthmark, like a bowtie on his chest and a small tuft of down on his head which has not yet moulted off.
I don't know Wishful. I still don't think he's ready.
A high shot reveals the miles of frozen ice that the GRADUATES have to cover to get to the sea.

Characters.Character: AT THE EDGE OF THE ICE

Replies.Reply: The juvenile penguins stand in a bunch, peering down looking for somewhere to dive in.
..I agree.
Transformed into creatures of grace and exuberance, they swoop and dive trailing plumes of bubbles.
The Adelies shoot back up to the surface. Mumble sinks, slightly dazed, watching the kalaeidescope patters of the surface recede.
Mumble keeps sinking, down down down into a great cathedral-
Its peaceful here. Then something moves beside him and turns with a start to see: A MASSIVE EYE!!
"Suntanned bodies and the waves of sunshine.
"In the warmed up weather, let's get together and do it again."
Skidding out of control, they COLLIDE, ending up in a breathless heap on top of each other.
Hi Ella.
Why don't I have it   Suddenly, A SKUA BIRD swoops down and grabs it.
Heaven. Where d'you think?
Dunno. Don't care. We got food. We got water. You hear a seal now and then, but you never meet one. Perfect.
Fish!
MUMBLE!!!
"Gotta keep those lovin' good Vibrations A happenin' with her."
We find MUMBLE on his own small ice-floe separate from the others on their iceberg.
He is woken by A NUDGE at his little raft of ice.
A small group of ADELIE PENGUINS recoil as MUMBLE explodes out of the hole, closely followed by the LEOPARD SEAL.
..Cos we got personality!.
begging for it.
IT!
..Addidas amigos!
here.
here.
Huddle??!
Woooaaaahhh!!
Hey, amigo. Do that again!
That thing with The feet.
Show them!
Hombre, you got so much already, you dangerous.
Wait. Look.
Man. You're an emperor all right, You're a king among emperors. The singing we can fix.
No problem. Which way's this colony of yours?
Why don't he speak?
Any better?
Oh my! Now he thinks he's an Elephant Seal  LOVEDAY nods and points towards the mountains.
He wants to go to the top of the mountain.
Maybe they invisible.
What is that?
As long as it's a good whale, not the other kind.
I know where you live.
Ramos!
Okay. Okay. Here's the plan: we go and ask the revered one.
Tell me again where we're going.
How do we know where they live.
You say Hi. Come back and say Hi to her yourself  Mumble turns, takes a few paces back.
What?
..Hey, how tall you think the Tall Guy was?
They've reached the edge of the sea-ice. LOVEDAY croaks a warning. He points out to sea.
A vast, boisterous ADELIE PENGUIN COMMUNITY. Thousands of them, stretching as far as the eye can see. Its very Rio, very samba, worlds away from the sedate Emperor colony.
Hey. Cool. Where'd you learn that?
Do it again.
Yow!
The Mystic Beings are speaking to me.
One pebble, one question. Next!
A little nervous? That's normal. Take your time.
No time wasters. Next!
Enough! How many questions is that? You don't have enough pebbles.
SILENCIO!! The Mystic Beings are speaking. They say show some respect stranger. Especially to the One who Knows.
The reason there are not enough fish is simple: There is not enough love in the world. Love is the answer!
One at a time! And don't touch the Talisman!
Disappeared ones Tell me is she alive?
But is she with another male?
..Me Loveday.
Try sitting on the ice for a month. It might come to you Salsa Boy. Come on, Consuela.
Gotta be some rocks left here somewhere!
Hey big guy, got any love stones over where you come from?
It is autumn, the EMPEROR PENGUINS for the mating season.
Silence, then across the vast expanse a TINY FIGURE appears on the horizon.
Tall and tanned and young and lovely..

Characters.Character: WHAT IS THE MEANING OF THIS

Replies.Reply: ABOMINATION?!!
Don't touch me! Heathen!!
No, Son they're right.
"Divided we freeze."
Recite the Wisdoms!
"In the Wisdoms we trust."
"We Remain."
"We Remain."
Most of the Adelies are sitting on nests. The Adeleies and Mumble trek past them a protective mother takes a peck at them.
The Adelies labour uphill into the wind. LOVEDAY is lagging behind, breathing hard.

Characters.Character: THE LAND OF THE ELEPHANT SEALS

Replies.Reply: The beach is literally heaving.
Ramon. That was embarrassing, man.
What other kind?!!
MUMBLE, LOVEDAY and the ADELIES are tiny specks, struggling over a series of great ridges.
The blizzard has passed. An eerie stillness.
The PENGUINS venture through it, dwarfed by the old flensing-
Mumble and the Adelies venture out onto the weak ice beyond the whaling station, finding more and more of the strange artefacts: a piece of nylon rope, a soda can, a boot.
The PENGUINS head for shore , swimming for their lives.
MUMBLE and LOVEDAY scramble onto the ice exhausted.
Beyond the last of the ice floes is THE WORLD'S TALLEST ICEBERG. MUMBLE hurls himself onto it and starts scrambling up its precipitous sides. THE ADELIES follow, struggling to keep up.
The SEAS are MOUNTAINOUS. There is no sign of the ship now, nor of land.
He's looking for a mate, mate. And these days, I tell you they're few and far between  From the ALBATROSS' aerial view, Mumble looks tiny next to the MASSIVE BULK of the Blue Whale.
Talking of which, I never seen a penguin this far out. Watch you don't hit The Convergence mate.
Where the cold water meets the warm, mate. Once you cross it, there's no getting' back. What you tryinmg to prove anyway?
The who?
Them. Fish is just the start of it Mate.
Straight up mate. Biggest creatures ever lived. Decimated, mate.
Mumble hesitates, bobbing on the water, weighing the warnings.
Don't say I didn't warn you  The ALBATROSS wheels away.

We see from above, the BLUE WHALE turning as well, changing course to avoid a change in the texture and colour of the water stretching in a line, as far as the eye can see. MUMBLE swims RIGHT ACROSS THE LINE.
MUMBLE is a mere DOT now as the GREAT CURRENTS capture him and sweep him away.
On the HIGH-WATER MARK, amongst the rubbish and the oil slick, we see what looks like a dead animal. It is MUMBLE.
Scientific books and specimens of birds in large bottles on shelves line the walls.
We hear a feeble thumping from inside.
A 747 drones across the screen, eastwards into the night.
Bright BLUE SKY, sparkling WHITE CLIFFS OF ICE.
Look Mommy! It's dancing!
Mumble, woken from his reverie, looks up and sees her looking at him.
The Gallery is packed. Mumble keeps dancing 77.
Theres a riot going on up there. People fighting to get a view. Newspaper reporters, TV cameras.
A squawking Mumble is thrust inside and the lid slams shut on him. Kerchunk.
Its what they understand. They can't talk, they can't sing. They speak with their feet. Do it.
HUMAN scientists disembark. Skidoos are kicked into life.
Suited figures are seated round a large table, watching as IMAGES of the DANCING PENGUIN COLONY play on a video screen.
And the international treaty?
What the heck. The amount of publicity this is generating, they'd have world war three if they didn't stop.
disorder? a nutritional deficiency perhaps. We'd certainly back the long-term study.
More or less. But one of the stars we're harvesting supports these things here.
